title: Visual Voicemail button missing after doing a Factory reset and restore
content:
Pixel 4 XL.  Android 10, Feb 5, 2020, system patch level.
Phone app Feb 3, 2020, update (per play store)
Phone set to do automatic updates
If I uninstall the app updates, with Wi-Fi off (per another thread) and then reboot, and then install updates, I get the button on the bottom right of the App back but I loose "Call Screening feature"
In settings, Visual Voicemail shows enabled.
BUT
when I reboot again (tried with both Wi-Fi off and with it ON) ( turned the phone off, left off for a few min and then powered on) the Visual voicemail feature goes away.
I also am losing the Call Screening functionality,
I have a 2nd Pixel 4 XL that isn't having this problem. It did at one point but uninstalling the updates and re-installing them fixed the problem.

I have also tried, clear cache and force stop.

Please help
category: Contacts, Calls, Voicemail, Google Pixel 4 XL
